exclusion:
Initiate exclusion on your hub

Tap the z-wave button 3 times quickly
inclusion:
Initiate inclusion on your hub

Tap the z-wave button 3 times quickly
label: ZEN52
overview:
Control 2 loads individually

Resistive loads up to 5A

LED lights up to 100W

700 series Z-Wave chip for better range and faster control

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: LED Indicator
parameters.overview: Enable or disable the LED indicator to reflect the current on/off status of the connected loads (LED on when either load is on, LED off when both loads are off)

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Turn off relay 1 after a given time
parameters.overview: Set the time after which you want the device connected to relay 1 to turn off once it has been turned on. The number can be minutes or seconds, as set in Parameter 7

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Automatically turn on relay 1 after a given time
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to relay 1 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes or seconds (set the unit in Par. 7)

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Automatically turn off relay 2 after a given time
parameters.overview: Set the time after which you want the device connected to relay 2 to turn off once it has been turned on. The number can be minutes or seconds, as set in Parameter 8

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Automatically turn on relay 2 after a given time
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to relay 2 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes or seconds (set the unit in Par. 8).

parameters.label: Timer Unit (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Set the units for auto on/off of relay 1
parameters.overview: Choose between seconds and minutes as the unit for the timers for relay 1 set in parameters 3 and 4

parameters.label: Timer Unit (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Set the units for auto on/off of relay 2
parameters.overview: Choose between seconds and minutes as the unit for the timers for relay 2 set in parameters 5 and 6.

parameters.label: On / Off Status After Power Failure (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Set the on/off status for relay 1 after power failure.

options.label: Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)

parameters.label: On / Off Status After Power Failure (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Set the on/off status for relay 2 after power failure.

options.label: Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Scene Control
parameters.description: Enable or disable scene control functionality
parameters.overview: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick multi-tap triggers (works best with momentary wall switches).

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Mode (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Enable or disable physical or Z-Wave control for relay 1
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable physical and/or Z-Wave on/off control for relay 1. If disabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

Values: 0 – button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled (the relay will still report on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled). 1 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default). 2 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled (the relay will still report on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled physically or via Z-Wave).

options.label: Button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled
Button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default)
Button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Mode (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Enable or disable physical or Z-Wave control for relay 2
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable physical and/or Z-Wave on/off control for relay 2. If disabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

Values: 0 – button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled (the relay will still report on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled). 1 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default). 2 – button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled (the relay will still report on/off control to the hub whenever the button or switch are toggled physically or via Z-Wave).

options.label: Button and wall switch control disabled, Z-Wave control enabled
Button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control enabled (default)
Button, wall switch, and Z-Wave control control disabled

parameters.label: External Switch Type (relay1)
parameters.description: Choose the type of wall switch connected to relay 1 and its on/off behavior.
parameters.overview: Values: 0 – toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status); 1 – momentary switch (one-button switch like the ZAC99); 2 – toggle switch with fixed actions (always toggle up for on, always toggle down for off); 3 – 3-way impulse control (for selected 3-way scenarios, refer to the notes in the wiring instructions for your set-up). Default: 2.

parameters.label: External Switch Type (relay2)
parameters.description: Choose the type of wall switch connected to relay 2 and its on/off behavior.
parameters.overview: Values: 0 – toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status); 1 – momentary switch (one-button switch like the ZAC99); 2 – toggle switch with fixed actions (always toggle up for on, always toggle down for off); 3 – 3-way impulse control (for selected 3-way scenarios, refer to the notes in the wiring instructions for your set-up). Default: 2.

parameters.label: Impulse Duration for 3-Way Impulse Control (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Choose the duration of the impulse if you're using relay 1 with 3-way impulse control (parameter 20 set to value 3).

parameters.label: Impulse Duration for 3-Way Impulse Control (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Choose the duration of the impulse if you're using relay 2 with 3-way impulse control (parameter 21 set to value 3).

parameters.label: Association Reports
parameters.description: Choose the type of reports the relays will send to the hub for Z-Wave and external switch control.

options.label: binary switch reports for Z-Wave control and basic reports for switch
binary switch reports for both Z-Wave and switch control (default)

parameters.label: Relay Type Behavior (Relay 1)
parameters.description: Select between normally open or normally closed relay 1 control
parameters.overview: Choose if you'd like relay 1 to act as a normally open (on when the circuit is closed, off when the circuit it open), or a normally closed relay (off when the circuit is closed, on when the circuit it open).

parameters.label: Relay Type Behavior (Relay 2)
parameters.description: Select between normally open or normally closed relay 2 control
parameters.overview: Choose if you'd like relay 2 to act as a normally open (on when the circuit is closed, off when the circuit it open), or a normally closed relay (off when the circuit is closed, on when the circuit it open).

associations.label: Group 2
associations.description: Send BASIC SET command for switch 1

associations.label: Group 3
associations.description: Send BASIC SET command for switch 2
